headline: The 5 Most Interesting Analyst Questions From Estée Lauder’s Q1 Earnings Call
summary: Estée Lauder’s first quarter of 2025 saw revenue and non-GAAP profit outperform Wall Street expectations, even as the company faced a nearly 10% year-over-year decline in sales. Management pointed to ongoing weakness in travel retail and softer consumer sentiment in China and the U.S. as primary factors impacting results. CEO Stéphane de La Faverie emphasized that, despite these headwinds, the company gained market share in the U.S., China, and Japan, with brands like Clinique, The Ordinary, and
